meanings.definition: The 19th letter of the Greek alphabet.
meanings.sent1: In the Greek alphabet, tau comes after sigma.
meanings.sent2: When learning Greek, you will encounter tau in the alphabet.
meanings.sent3: The tau looked like a fancy 'T' doing a dance.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so elegant, each tau seemed like a graceful swan.
meanings.sent5: The tau symbol stood out boldly on the page, demanding attention.

meanings.definition: A protein that stabilizes microtubules in cells.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study how tau helps cells stay strong.
meanings.sent2: The tau protein plays a crucial role in cell structure.
meanings.sent3: Under the microscope, the tau protein winked mischievously.
meanings.sent4: The tau protein acted like a superhero, holding the cells together.
meanings.sent5: In the world of cells, tau is the unsung hero keeping everything in place.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure used in physics to represent torque.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic measured the torque in tau units.
meanings.sent2: Tau is a useful measure when dealing with torque.
meanings.sent3: The tau unit whispered secrets of force and motion.
meanings.sent4: As the engine roared, the tau value soared, indicating power.
meanings.sent5: The tau measurement spun around the room, showing the strength of the engine.
